intro: Poa annua f. macranthera, commonly known as the broad-leaved annual bluegrass, is a variant of the common annual bluegrass. It is characterized by its broader leaves and larger, more showy inflorescences compared to the typical form. This grass species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. Its botanical features include slender,丛生 stems and spikelets that are more elongated and clustered. It is a cool-season grass that is sometimes used in turfgrass mixtures due to its fine texture and rapid growth.
